symptoms: Symptoms: RAM slot failure. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Motherboard Errors.
cause: Faulty motherboard components, damaged traces, or failed POST due to VRM or chipset faults.
step_1: Power down, unplug, and inspect motherboard for visible damage or bulging caps.
step_2: Clear CMOS by removing CMOS battery or using jumper to reset BIOS settings.
step_3: Reseat CPU, RAM, and power connectors; ensure no standoffs short the board.
step_4: Listen for beep codes and consult manual to interpret POST errors.
step_5: If board is faulty, backup data and replace the motherboard.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: RAM slot failure - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: Thermal paste dried - my PC behaves oddly and I need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: Thermal paste dried. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Cooling System Errors.
cause: Failed fans, dried thermal paste, clogged heatsinks leading to thermal throttling or shutdowns.
step_1: Inspect and clean dust from fans and heatsinks; ensure fans spin freely.
step_2: Reapply thermal paste on CPU if it is older than 2–3 years.
step_3: Ensure proper case airflow: intake at front, exhaust at rear/top.
step_4: Replace failed fans and check fan headers and cables for power.
step_5: Consider upgrading cooler if temperatures remain high under load.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Thermal paste dried - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: After recent changes I now experience: Screen artifacts.
symptoms: Symptoms: Screen artifacts. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: GPU / Graphics Card Errors.
cause: GPU overheating, driver failure, or power/connectivity issues to the graphics card.
step_1: Ensure GPU power connectors are firmly attached and card is seated in PCIe slot.
step_2: Boot into Safe Mode and reinstall GPU drivers (use DDU for clean uninstall).
step_3: Monitor GPU temperatures and clean dust from heatsink/fans.
step_4: Test with integrated graphics or another GPU to isolate the card.
step_5: If hardware failure confirmed, RMA or replace the GPU.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Screen artifacts - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

category: Hard Drive / SSD / Storage Device Errors
user_error_text: After recent changes I now experience: Bad sectors detected.
symptoms: Symptoms: Bad sectors detected. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Hard Drive / SSD / Storage Device Errors.
cause: Failing storage device, bad sectors, or controller issues causing read/write errors.
step_1: Backup important data immediately to an external drive if accessible.
step_2: Run SMART check using vendor tools (CrystalDiskInfo) to inspect drive health.
step_3: Run chkdsk on the affected drive: `chkdsk D: /f /r` (replace D: as needed).
step_4: Try connecting the drive to another port or PC to verify detection.
step_5: If SMART indicates failure, replace the drive and restore data from backup.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Bad sectors detected - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: After recent changes I now experience: Broken SATA connector.
symptoms: Symptoms: Broken SATA connector. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Cable & Connector Issues.
cause: Loose or damaged cables/connectors causing intermittent device detection or power issues.
step_1: Power down and reseat SATA/HDMI/DisplayPort/PCIe power cables securely.
step_2: Try a different cable to rule out a faulty cable.
step_3: Inspect connectors for bent pins or corrosion and replace if damaged.
step_4: Ensure cables are not pinched and have proper strain relief.
step_5: Use cable ties to avoid accidental unplugging and test again.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Broken SATA connector - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: CPU overheating happens randomly and causes crashes.
symptoms: Symptoms: CPU overheating. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: CPU / Processor Errors.
cause: CPU thermal issues, insufficient cooling, or motherboard/VRM instability.
step_1: Check CPU cooler mounting and ensure fan(s) spin at boot.
step_2: Reset BIOS to defaults and disable overclocking/XMP profiles.
step_3: Monitor CPU temperatures in BIOS or with a tool; replace thermal paste if needed.
step_4: Run a short CPU stress test to check for throttling or errors.
step_5: If CPU faults persist, consult hardware support—consider replacing CPU/motherboard.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: CPU overheating - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: My computer reports: USB device shorting motherboard — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: USB device shorting motherboard. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Peripheral & External Hardware Failures.
cause: External device fault or short causing system instability or boot problems.
step_1: Disconnect external devices one-by-one and check if issue stops to identify the faulty peripheral.
step_2: Try the device on another system to confirm if it is defective.
step_3: Update peripheral drivers and firmware from the manufacturer's site.
step_4: Use a powered USB hub for devices that need extra power.
step_5: Replace the peripheral if it causes repeated system instability.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: USB device shorting motherboard - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

step_1: Power down and reseat SATA/HDMI/DisplayPort/PCIe power cables securely.

user_error_text: Low-voltage instability happens randomly and causes crashes.
symptoms: Symptoms: Low-voltage instability. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Power Supply Unit (PSU) Errors.
cause: Unstable or insufficient power delivery from the power supply affecting system stability.
step_1: Check all power cables (24-pin, 8-pin) are fully connected to motherboard and GPU.
step_2: Try a different known-good power outlet and avoid overloaded power strips.
step_3: If possible, test with a spare PSU or a PSU tester to verify voltages.
step_4: Do not continue using a PSU that emits burning smells—replace immediately.
step_5: Ensure PSU wattage is sufficient for your components; upgrade if underpowered.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Low-voltage instability - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: My computer reports: Memory mismatch — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Memory mismatch. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: RAM / Memory Errors.
cause: Faulty RAM modules, incorrect timings/voltage, or slot issues causing memory errors.
step_1: Power off and unplug the PC, then carefully remove and reseat RAM sticks.
step_2: Try one RAM stick at a time to identify a faulty module.
step_3: Run Windows Memory Diagnostic (mdsched.exe) or MemTest86 for extended testing.
step_4: Check BIOS for correct memory settings; disable XMP/overclocking to test stability.
step_5: Replace the failing RAM module if diagnostics report errors.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Memory mismatch - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: After recent changes I now experience: CPU overheating.
symptoms: Symptoms: CPU overheating. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: CPU / Processor Errors.
cause: CPU thermal issues, insufficient cooling, or motherboard/VRM instability.
step_1: Check CPU cooler mounting and ensure fan(s) spin at boot.
step_2: Reset BIOS to defaults and disable overclocking/XMP profiles.
step_3: Monitor CPU temperatures in BIOS or with a tool; replace thermal paste if needed.
step_4: Run a short CPU stress test to check for throttling or errors.
step_5: If CPU faults persist, consult hardware support—consider replacing CPU/motherboard.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: CPU overheating - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

category: Hard Drive / SSD / Storage Device Errors
user_error_text: After recent changes I now experience: SMART warning - drive failing.
symptoms: Symptoms: SMART warning - drive failing. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Hard Drive / SSD / Storage Device Errors.
cause: Failing storage device, bad sectors, or controller issues causing read/write errors.
step_1: Backup important data immediately to an external drive if accessible.
step_2: Run SMART check using vendor tools (CrystalDiskInfo) to inspect drive health.
step_3: Run chkdsk on the affected drive: `chkdsk D: /f /r` (replace D: as needed).
step_4: Try connecting the drive to another port or PC to verify detection.
step_5: If SMART indicates failure, replace the drive and restore data from backup.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: SMART warning - drive failing - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: My computer reports: Random freezes due to RAM — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Random freezes due to RAM. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: RAM / Memory Errors.
cause: Faulty RAM modules, incorrect timings/voltage, or slot issues causing memory errors.
step_1: Power off and unplug the PC, then carefully remove and reseat RAM sticks.
step_2: Try one RAM stick at a time to identify a faulty module.
step_3: Run Windows Memory Diagnostic (mdsched.exe) or MemTest86 for extended testing.
step_4: Check BIOS for correct memory settings; disable XMP/overclocking to test stability.
step_5: Replace the failing RAM module if diagnostics report errors.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Random freezes due to RAM - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: My computer reports: Case fan failure — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Case fan failure. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Cooling System Errors.
cause: Failed fans, dried thermal paste, clogged heatsinks leading to thermal throttling or shutdowns.
step_1: Inspect and clean dust from fans and heatsinks; ensure fans spin freely.
step_2: Reapply thermal paste on CPU if it is older than 2–3 years.
step_3: Ensure proper case airflow: intake at front, exhaust at rear/top.
step_4: Replace failed fans and check fan headers and cables for power.
step_5: Consider upgrading cooler if temperatures remain high under load.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Case fan failure - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: I see 'Low-voltage instability' and the system is unstable.
symptoms: Symptoms: Low-voltage instability. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Power Supply Unit (PSU) Errors.
cause: Unstable or insufficient power delivery from the power supply affecting system stability.
step_1: Check all power cables (24-pin, 8-pin) are fully connected to motherboard and GPU.
step_2: Try a different known-good power outlet and avoid overloaded power strips.
step_3: If possible, test with a spare PSU or a PSU tester to verify voltages.
step_4: Do not continue using a PSU that emits burning smells—replace immediately.
step_5: Ensure PSU wattage is sufficient for your components; upgrade if underpowered.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Low-voltage instability - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: Printer not working - my PC behaves oddly and I need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: Printer not working. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Peripheral & External Hardware Failures.
cause: External device fault or short causing system instability or boot problems.
step_1: Disconnect external devices one-by-one and check if issue stops to identify the faulty peripheral.
step_2: Try the device on another system to confirm if it is defective.
step_3: Update peripheral drivers and firmware from the manufacturer's site.
step_4: Use a powered USB hub for devices that need extra power.
step_5: Replace the peripheral if it causes repeated system instability.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Printer not working - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

cause: GPU overheating, driver failure, or power/connectivity issues to the graphics card.

step_4: Test with integrated graphics or another GPU to isolate the card.
step_5: If hardware failure confirmed, RMA or replace the GPU.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.

symptoms: Symptoms: USB ports not working. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Motherboard Errors.
cause: Faulty motherboard components, damaged traces, or failed POST due to VRM or chipset faults.
step_1: Power down, unplug, and inspect motherboard for visible damage or bulging caps.
step_2: Clear CMOS by removing CMOS battery or using jumper to reset BIOS settings.
step_3: Reseat CPU, RAM, and power connectors; ensure no standoffs short the board.
step_4: Listen for beep codes and consult manual to interpret POST errors.
step_5: If board is faulty, backup data and replace the motherboard.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.

step_4: Check BIOS for correct memory settings; disable XMP/overclocking to test stability.
step_5: Replace the failing RAM module if diagnostics report errors.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Random freezes due to RAM - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

category: Hard Drive / SSD / Storage Device Errors
user_error_text: Disk not detected - my PC behaves oddly and I need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: Disk not detected. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Hard Drive / SSD / Storage Device Errors.
cause: Failing storage device, bad sectors, or controller issues causing read/write errors.
step_1: Backup important data immediately to an external drive if accessible.
step_2: Run SMART check using vendor tools (CrystalDiskInfo) to inspect drive health.
step_3: Run chkdsk on the affected drive: `chkdsk D: /f /r` (replace D: as needed).
step_4: Try connecting the drive to another port or PC to verify detection.
step_5: If SMART indicates failure, replace the drive and restore data from backup.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Disk not detected - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: POST beeps for RAM failure - my PC behaves oddly and I need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: POST beeps for RAM failure. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: RAM / Memory Errors.
cause: Faulty RAM modules, incorrect timings/voltage, or slot issues causing memory errors.
step_1: Power off and unplug the PC, then carefully remove and reseat RAM sticks.
step_2: Try one RAM stick at a time to identify a faulty module.
step_3: Run Windows Memory Diagnostic (mdsched.exe) or MemTest86 for extended testing.
step_4: Check BIOS for correct memory settings; disable XMP/overclocking to test stability.
step_5: Replace the failing RAM module if diagnostics report errors.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: POST beeps for RAM failure - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: I see 'Faulty keyboard causing freezes' and the system is unstable.
symptoms: Symptoms: Faulty keyboard causing freezes. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Peripheral & External Hardware Failures.
cause: External device fault or short causing system instability or boot problems.
step_1: Disconnect external devices one-by-one and check if issue stops to identify the faulty peripheral.
step_2: Try the device on another system to confirm if it is defective.
step_3: Update peripheral drivers and firmware from the manufacturer's site.
step_4: Use a powered USB hub for devices that need extra power.
step_5: Replace the peripheral if it causes repeated system instability.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Faulty keyboard causing freezes - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: I see 'Airflow blockage' and the system is unstable.
symptoms: Symptoms: Airflow blockage. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Cooling System Errors.
cause: Failed fans, dried thermal paste, clogged heatsinks leading to thermal throttling or shutdowns.
step_1: Inspect and clean dust from fans and heatsinks; ensure fans spin freely.
step_2: Reapply thermal paste on CPU if it is older than 2–3 years.
step_3: Ensure proper case airflow: intake at front, exhaust at rear/top.
step_4: Replace failed fans and check fan headers and cables for power.
step_5: Consider upgrading cooler if temperatures remain high under load.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Airflow blockage - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: Failed motherboard POST happens randomly and causes crashes.
symptoms: Symptoms: Failed motherboard POST. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Motherboard Errors.
cause: Faulty motherboard components, damaged traces, or failed POST due to VRM or chipset faults.
step_1: Power down, unplug, and inspect motherboard for visible damage or bulging caps.
step_2: Clear CMOS by removing CMOS battery or using jumper to reset BIOS settings.
step_3: Reseat CPU, RAM, and power connectors; ensure no standoffs short the board.
step_4: Listen for beep codes and consult manual to interpret POST errors.
step_5: If board is faulty, backup data and replace the motherboard.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Failed motherboard POST - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: I see 'PCIe slot not detecting GPU' and the system is unstable.
symptoms: Symptoms: PCIe slot not detecting GPU. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: GPU / Graphics Card Errors.
cause: GPU overheating, driver failure, or power/connectivity issues to the graphics card.
step_1: Ensure GPU power connectors are firmly attached and card is seated in PCIe slot.
step_2: Boot into Safe Mode and reinstall GPU drivers (use DDU for clean uninstall).
step_3: Monitor GPU temperatures and clean dust from heatsink/fans.
step_4: Test with integrated graphics or another GPU to isolate the card.
step_5: If hardware failure confirmed, RMA or replace the GPU.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: PCIe slot not detecting GPU - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

error_name: Loose SATA cable - drive not detected
user_error_text: My computer reports: Loose SATA cable - drive not detected — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Loose SATA cable - drive not detected. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Cable & Connector Issues.
cause: Loose or damaged cables/connectors causing intermittent device detection or power issues.
step_1: Power down and reseat SATA/HDMI/DisplayPort/PCIe power cables securely.
step_2: Try a different cable to rule out a faulty cable.
step_3: Inspect connectors for bent pins or corrosion and replace if damaged.
step_4: Ensure cables are not pinched and have proper strain relief.
step_5: Use cable ties to avoid accidental unplugging and test again.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Loose SATA cable - drive not detected - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: Case airflow insufficient happens randomly and causes crashes.
symptoms: Symptoms: Case airflow insufficient. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Overheating & Thermal Failures.
cause: Poor airflow, failed cooling components, or degraded thermal interface causing overheating.
step_1: Check case fans and airflow; clean dust and ensure unobstructed vents.
step_2: Monitor temperatures under load and at idle to identify spikes.
step_3: Reapply thermal paste to CPU/GPU if paste is old or dried.
step_4: Ensure laptop vents are clear and use a cooling pad for laptops.
step_5: If temperatures remain high, upgrade cooling components (better cooler, additional fans).
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Case airflow insufficient - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: After recent changes I now experience: Machine Check Exception (MCE).
symptoms: Symptoms: Machine Check Exception (MCE). Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: CPU / Processor Errors.
cause: CPU thermal issues, insufficient cooling, or motherboard/VRM instability.
step_1: Check CPU cooler mounting and ensure fan(s) spin at boot.
step_2: Reset BIOS to defaults and disable overclocking/XMP profiles.
step_3: Monitor CPU temperatures in BIOS or with a tool; replace thermal paste if needed.
step_4: Run a short CPU stress test to check for throttling or errors.
step_5: If CPU faults persist, consult hardware support—consider replacing CPU/motherboard.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.

user_error_text: PC won't power on happens randomly and causes crashes.
symptoms: Symptoms: PC won't power on. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Power Supply Unit (PSU) Errors.
cause: Unstable or insufficient power delivery from the power supply affecting system stability.
step_1: Check all power cables (24-pin, 8-pin) are fully connected to motherboard and GPU.
step_2: Try a different known-good power outlet and avoid overloaded power strips.
step_3: If possible, test with a spare PSU or a PSU tester to verify voltages.
step_4: Do not continue using a PSU that emits burning smells—replace immediately.
step_5: Ensure PSU wattage is sufficient for your components; upgrade if underpowered.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: PC won't power on - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

step_4: Test with integrated graphics or another GPU to isolate the card.
step_5: If hardware failure confirmed, RMA or replace the GPU.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: GPU overheating - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

category: Hard Drive / SSD / Storage Device Errors
user_error_text: I see 'SMART warning - drive failing' and the system is unstable.
symptoms: Symptoms: SMART warning - drive failing. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Hard Drive / SSD / Storage Device Errors.
cause: Failing storage device, bad sectors, or controller issues causing read/write errors.
step_1: Backup important data immediately to an external drive if accessible.
step_2: Run SMART check using vendor tools (CrystalDiskInfo) to inspect drive health.
step_3: Run chkdsk on the affected drive: `chkdsk D: /f /r` (replace D: as needed).
step_4: Try connecting the drive to another port or PC to verify detection.
step_5: If SMART indicates failure, replace the drive and restore data from backup.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: SMART warning - drive failing - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: Case fan failure happens randomly and causes crashes.
symptoms: Symptoms: Case fan failure. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Cooling System Errors.
cause: Failed fans, dried thermal paste, clogged heatsinks leading to thermal throttling or shutdowns.
step_1: Inspect and clean dust from fans and heatsinks; ensure fans spin freely.
step_2: Reapply thermal paste on CPU if it is older than 2–3 years.
step_3: Ensure proper case airflow: intake at front, exhaust at rear/top.
step_4: Replace failed fans and check fan headers and cables for power.
step_5: Consider upgrading cooler if temperatures remain high under load.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Case fan failure - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: Webcam not detected - my PC behaves oddly and I need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: Webcam not detected. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Peripheral & External Hardware Failures.
cause: External device fault or short causing system instability or boot problems.
step_1: Disconnect external devices one-by-one and check if issue stops to identify the faulty peripheral.
step_2: Try the device on another system to confirm if it is defective.
step_3: Update peripheral drivers and firmware from the manufacturer's site.
step_4: Use a powered USB hub for devices that need extra power.
step_5: Replace the peripheral if it causes repeated system instability.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Webcam not detected - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

category: Hard Drive / SSD / Storage Device Errors
user_error_text: I see 'SMART warning - drive failing' and the system is unstable.
symptoms: Symptoms: SMART warning - drive failing. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Hard Drive / SSD / Storage Device Errors.
cause: Failing storage device, bad sectors, or controller issues causing read/write errors.
step_1: Backup important data immediately to an external drive if accessible.
step_2: Run SMART check using vendor tools (CrystalDiskInfo) to inspect drive health.

user_error_text: After recent changes I now experience: PSU overload under GPU load.
symptoms: Symptoms: PSU overload under GPU load. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Power Supply Unit (PSU) Errors.
cause: Unstable or insufficient power delivery from the power supply affecting system stability.
step_1: Check all power cables (24-pin, 8-pin) are fully connected to motherboard and GPU.
step_2: Try a different known-good power outlet and avoid overloaded power strips.
step_3: If possible, test with a spare PSU or a PSU tester to verify voltages.
step_4: Do not continue using a PSU that emits burning smells—replace immediately.
step_5: Ensure PSU wattage is sufficient for your components; upgrade if underpowered.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: PSU overload under GPU load - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: My computer reports: HDD overheating in laptop — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: HDD overheating in laptop. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Overheating & Thermal Failures.
cause: Poor airflow, failed cooling components, or degraded thermal interface causing overheating.
step_1: Check case fans and airflow; clean dust and ensure unobstructed vents.
step_2: Monitor temperatures under load and at idle to identify spikes.
step_3: Reapply thermal paste to CPU/GPU if paste is old or dried.
step_4: Ensure laptop vents are clear and use a cooling pad for laptops.
step_5: If temperatures remain high, upgrade cooling components (better cooler, additional fans).
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: HDD overheating in laptop - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: PCIe cable not fully inserted happens randomly and causes crashes.
symptoms: Symptoms: PCIe cable not fully inserted. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Cable & Connector Issues.
cause: Loose or damaged cables/connectors causing intermittent device detection or power issues.
step_1: Power down and reseat SATA/HDMI/DisplayPort/PCIe power cables securely.
step_2: Try a different cable to rule out a faulty cable.
step_3: Inspect connectors for bent pins or corrosion and replace if damaged.
step_4: Ensure cables are not pinched and have proper strain relief.
step_5: Use cable ties to avoid accidental unplugging and test again.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: PCIe cable not fully inserted - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: Memory instability (XMP/OC) - my PC behaves oddly and I need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: Memory instability (XMP/OC). Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: RAM / Memory Errors.
cause: Faulty RAM modules, incorrect timings/voltage, or slot issues causing memory errors.
step_1: Power off and unplug the PC, then carefully remove and reseat RAM sticks.
step_2: Try one RAM stick at a time to identify a faulty module.
step_3: Run Windows Memory Diagnostic (mdsched.exe) or MemTest86 for extended testing.
step_4: Check BIOS for correct memory settings; disable XMP/overclocking to test stability.
step_5: Replace the failing RAM module if diagnostics report errors.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Memory instability (XMP/OC) - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: I see 'RAM slot failure' and the system is unstable.
symptoms: Symptoms: RAM slot failure. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Motherboard Errors.
cause: Faulty motherboard components, damaged traces, or failed POST due to VRM or chipset faults.
step_1: Power down, unplug, and inspect motherboard for visible damage or bulging caps.
step_2: Clear CMOS by removing CMOS battery or using jumper to reset BIOS settings.
step_3: Reseat CPU, RAM, and power connectors; ensure no standoffs short the board.
step_4: Listen for beep codes and consult manual to interpret POST errors.
step_5: If board is faulty, backup data and replace the motherboard.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: RAM slot failure - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: After recent changes I now experience: GPU driver crash under load.
symptoms: Symptoms: GPU driver crash under load. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: GPU / Graphics Card Errors.
cause: GPU overheating, driver failure, or power/connectivity issues to the graphics card.
step_1: Ensure GPU power connectors are firmly attached and card is seated in PCIe slot.
step_2: Boot into Safe Mode and reinstall GPU drivers (use DDU for clean uninstall).
step_3: Monitor GPU temperatures and clean dust from heatsink/fans.
step_4: Test with integrated graphics or another GPU to isolate the card.
step_5: If hardware failure confirmed, RMA or replace the GPU.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: GPU driver crash under load - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

step_4: Listen for beep codes and consult manual to interpret POST errors.
step_5: If board is faulty, backup data and replace the motherboard.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Damaged VRM / power delivery - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

category: Hard Drive / SSD / Storage Device Errors
user_error_text: My computer reports: SMART warning - drive failing — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: SMART warning - drive failing. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Hard Drive / SSD / Storage Device Errors.
cause: Failing storage device, bad sectors, or controller issues causing read/write errors.
step_1: Backup important data immediately to an external drive if accessible.
step_2: Run SMART check using vendor tools (CrystalDiskInfo) to inspect drive health.
step_3: Run chkdsk on the affected drive: `chkdsk D: /f /r` (replace D: as needed).
step_4: Try connecting the drive to another port or PC to verify detection.
step_5: If SMART indicates failure, replace the drive and restore data from backup.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: SMART warning - drive failing - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: Thermal throttling - my PC behaves oddly and I need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: Thermal throttling. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: CPU / Processor Errors.
cause: CPU thermal issues, insufficient cooling, or motherboard/VRM instability.
step_1: Check CPU cooler mounting and ensure fan(s) spin at boot.
step_2: Reset BIOS to defaults and disable overclocking/XMP profiles.
step_3: Monitor CPU temperatures in BIOS or with a tool; replace thermal paste if needed.
step_4: Run a short CPU stress test to check for throttling or errors.
step_5: If CPU faults persist, consult hardware support—consider replacing CPU/motherboard.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Thermal throttling - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: Case fan failure happens randomly and causes crashes.
symptoms: Symptoms: Case fan failure. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Cooling System Errors.
cause: Failed fans, dried thermal paste, clogged heatsinks leading to thermal throttling or shutdowns.
step_1: Inspect and clean dust from fans and heatsinks; ensure fans spin freely.
step_2: Reapply thermal paste on CPU if it is older than 2–3 years.
step_3: Ensure proper case airflow: intake at front, exhaust at rear/top.
step_4: Replace failed fans and check fan headers and cables for power.
step_5: Consider upgrading cooler if temperatures remain high under load.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Case fan failure - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: My computer reports: Failed motherboard POST — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Failed motherboard POST. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Motherboard Errors.
cause: Faulty motherboard components, damaged traces, or failed POST due to VRM or chipset faults.
step_1: Power down, unplug, and inspect motherboard for visible damage or bulging caps.
step_2: Clear CMOS by removing CMOS battery or using jumper to reset BIOS settings.
step_3: Reseat CPU, RAM, and power connectors; ensure no standoffs short the board.
step_4: Listen for beep codes and consult manual to interpret POST errors.
step_5: If board is faulty, backup data and replace the motherboard.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Failed motherboard POST - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: My computer reports: HDD overheating in laptop — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: HDD overheating in laptop. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Overheating & Thermal Failures.
cause: Poor airflow, failed cooling components, or degraded thermal interface causing overheating.
step_1: Check case fans and airflow; clean dust and ensure unobstructed vents.
step_2: Monitor temperatures under load and at idle to identify spikes.
step_3: Reapply thermal paste to CPU/GPU if paste is old or dried.
step_4: Ensure laptop vents are clear and use a cooling pad for laptops.
step_5: If temperatures remain high, upgrade cooling components (better cooler, additional fans).
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: HDD overheating in laptop - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: POST beeps for RAM failure happens randomly and causes crashes.
symptoms: Symptoms: POST beeps for RAM failure. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: RAM / Memory Errors.
cause: Faulty RAM modules, incorrect timings/voltage, or slot issues causing memory errors.
step_1: Power off and unplug the PC, then carefully remove and reseat RAM sticks.
step_2: Try one RAM stick at a time to identify a faulty module.
step_3: Run Windows Memory Diagnostic (mdsched.exe) or MemTest86 for extended testing.
step_4: Check BIOS for correct memory settings; disable XMP/overclocking to test stability.
step_5: Replace the failing RAM module if diagnostics report errors.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: POST beeps for RAM failure - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: After recent changes I now experience: Burning smell from PSU.
symptoms: Symptoms: Burning smell from PSU. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Power Supply Unit (PSU) Errors.
cause: Unstable or insufficient power delivery from the power supply affecting system stability.
step_1: Check all power cables (24-pin, 8-pin) are fully connected to motherboard and GPU.
step_2: Try a different known-good power outlet and avoid overloaded power strips.
step_3: If possible, test with a spare PSU or a PSU tester to verify voltages.
step_4: Do not continue using a PSU that emits burning smells—replace immediately.
step_5: Ensure PSU wattage is sufficient for your components; upgrade if underpowered.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Burning smell from PSU - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: My computer reports: PCIe cable not fully inserted — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: PCIe cable not fully inserted. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Cable & Connector Issues.
cause: Loose or damaged cables/connectors causing intermittent device detection or power issues.
step_1: Power down and reseat SATA/HDMI/DisplayPort/PCIe power cables securely.
step_2: Try a different cable to rule out a faulty cable.
step_3: Inspect connectors for bent pins or corrosion and replace if damaged.
step_4: Ensure cables are not pinched and have proper strain relief.
step_5: Use cable ties to avoid accidental unplugging and test again.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: PCIe cable not fully inserted - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

cause: External device fault or short causing system instability or boot problems.
step_1: Disconnect external devices one-by-one and check if issue stops to identify the faulty peripheral.
step_2: Try the device on another system to confirm if it is defective.
step_3: Update peripheral drivers and firmware from the manufacturer's site.
step_4: Use a powered USB hub for devices that need extra power.
step_5: Replace the peripheral if it causes repeated system instability.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.

symptoms: Symptoms: Memory mismatch. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: RAM / Memory Errors.
cause: Faulty RAM modules, incorrect timings/voltage, or slot issues causing memory errors.
step_1: Power off and unplug the PC, then carefully remove and reseat RAM sticks.
step_2: Try one RAM stick at a time to identify a faulty module.
step_3: Run Windows Memory Diagnostic (mdsched.exe) or MemTest86 for extended testing.
step_4: Check BIOS for correct memory settings; disable XMP/overclocking to test stability.
step_5: Replace the failing RAM module if diagnostics report errors.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Memory mismatch - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: After recent changes I now experience: UNEXPECTED_KERNEL_MODE_TRAP.
symptoms: Symptoms: UNEXPECTED_KERNEL_MODE_TRAP. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: CPU / Processor Errors.
cause: CPU thermal issues, insufficient cooling, or motherboard/VRM instability.
step_1: Check CPU cooler mounting and ensure fan(s) spin at boot.
step_2: Reset BIOS to defaults and disable overclocking/XMP profiles.
step_3: Monitor CPU temperatures in BIOS or with a tool; replace thermal paste if needed.
step_4: Run a short CPU stress test to check for throttling or errors.
step_5: If CPU faults persist, consult hardware support—consider replacing CPU/motherboard.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: UNEXPECTED_KERNEL_MODE_TRAP - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: My computer reports: Clogged heatsinks — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Clogged heatsinks. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Cooling System Errors.
cause: Failed fans, dried thermal paste, clogged heatsinks leading to thermal throttling or shutdowns.
step_1: Inspect and clean dust from fans and heatsinks; ensure fans spin freely.
step_2: Reapply thermal paste on CPU if it is older than 2–3 years.
step_3: Ensure proper case airflow: intake at front, exhaust at rear/top.
step_4: Replace failed fans and check fan headers and cables for power.
step_5: Consider upgrading cooler if temperatures remain high under load.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Clogged heatsinks - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

category: Hard Drive / SSD / Storage Device Errors
error_name: Slow system due to SSD wear
user_error_text: After recent changes I now experience: Slow system due to SSD wear.
symptoms: Symptoms: Slow system due to SSD wear. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Hard Drive / SSD / Storage Device Errors.
cause: Failing storage device, bad sectors, or controller issues causing read/write errors.
step_1: Backup important data immediately to an external drive if accessible.
step_2: Run SMART check using vendor tools (CrystalDiskInfo) to inspect drive health.
step_3: Run chkdsk on the affected drive: `chkdsk D: /f /r` (replace D: as needed).
step_4: Try connecting the drive to another port or PC to verify detection.
step_5: If SMART indicates failure, replace the drive and restore data from backup.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Slow system due to SSD wear - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: I see 'Loose 24-pin cable' and the system is unstable.
symptoms: Symptoms: Loose 24-pin cable. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Power Supply Unit (PSU) Errors.
cause: Unstable or insufficient power delivery from the power supply affecting system stability.
step_1: Check all power cables (24-pin, 8-pin) are fully connected to motherboard and GPU.
step_2: Try a different known-good power outlet and avoid overloaded power strips.
step_3: If possible, test with a spare PSU or a PSU tester to verify voltages.
step_4: Do not continue using a PSU that emits burning smells—replace immediately.
step_5: Ensure PSU wattage is sufficient for your components; upgrade if underpowered.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Loose 24-pin cable - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: After recent changes I now experience: External drive not mounting.
symptoms: Symptoms: External drive not mounting. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Peripheral & External Hardware Failures.
cause: External device fault or short causing system instability or boot problems.
step_1: Disconnect external devices one-by-one and check if issue stops to identify the faulty peripheral.
step_2: Try the device on another system to confirm if it is defective.
step_3: Update peripheral drivers and firmware from the manufacturer's site.
step_4: Use a powered USB hub for devices that need extra power.
step_5: Replace the peripheral if it causes repeated system instability.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: External drive not mounting - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: GPU overheating happens randomly and causes crashes.
symptoms: Symptoms: GPU overheating. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: GPU / Graphics Card Errors.
cause: GPU overheating, driver failure, or power/connectivity issues to the graphics card.
step_1: Ensure GPU power connectors are firmly attached and card is seated in PCIe slot.
step_2: Boot into Safe Mode and reinstall GPU drivers (use DDU for clean uninstall).
step_3: Monitor GPU temperatures and clean dust from heatsink/fans.
step_4: Test with integrated graphics or another GPU to isolate the card.
step_5: If hardware failure confirmed, RMA or replace the GPU.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.

cause: Loose or damaged cables/connectors causing intermittent device detection or power issues.

step_5: Use cable ties to avoid accidental unplugging and test again.

user_error_text: I see 'Damaged VRM / power delivery' and the system is unstable.
symptoms: Symptoms: Damaged VRM / power delivery. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Motherboard Errors.
cause: Faulty motherboard components, damaged traces, or failed POST due to VRM or chipset faults.
step_1: Power down, unplug, and inspect motherboard for visible damage or bulging caps.
step_2: Clear CMOS by removing CMOS battery or using jumper to reset BIOS settings.
step_3: Reseat CPU, RAM, and power connectors; ensure no standoffs short the board.
step_4: Listen for beep codes and consult manual to interpret POST errors.
step_5: If board is faulty, backup data and replace the motherboard.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Damaged VRM / power delivery - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

symptoms: Symptoms: Black screen when GPU activates. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: GPU / Graphics Card Errors.
cause: GPU overheating, driver failure, or power/connectivity issues to the graphics card.
step_1: Ensure GPU power connectors are firmly attached and card is seated in PCIe slot.
step_2: Boot into Safe Mode and reinstall GPU drivers (use DDU for clean uninstall).
step_3: Monitor GPU temperatures and clean dust from heatsink/fans.
step_4: Test with integrated graphics or another GPU to isolate the card.
step_5: If hardware failure confirmed, RMA or replace the GPU.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Black screen when GPU activates - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: I see 'Broken SATA connector' and the system is unstable.
symptoms: Symptoms: Broken SATA connector. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Cable & Connector Issues.
cause: Loose or damaged cables/connectors causing intermittent device detection or power issues.
step_1: Power down and reseat SATA/HDMI/DisplayPort/PCIe power cables securely.
step_2: Try a different cable to rule out a faulty cable.
step_3: Inspect connectors for bent pins or corrosion and replace if damaged.
step_4: Ensure cables are not pinched and have proper strain relief.
step_5: Use cable ties to avoid accidental unplugging and test again.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Broken SATA connector - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: POST beeps for RAM failure - my PC behaves oddly and I need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: POST beeps for RAM failure. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: RAM / Memory Errors.
cause: Faulty RAM modules, incorrect timings/voltage, or slot issues causing memory errors.
step_1: Power off and unplug the PC, then carefully remove and reseat RAM sticks.
step_2: Try one RAM stick at a time to identify a faulty module.
step_3: Run Windows Memory Diagnostic (mdsched.exe) or MemTest86 for extended testing.
step_4: Check BIOS for correct memory settings; disable XMP/overclocking to test stability.
step_5: Replace the failing RAM module if diagnostics report errors.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: POST beeps for RAM failure - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: I see 'Clogged heatsinks' and the system is unstable.
symptoms: Symptoms: Clogged heatsinks. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Cooling System Errors.
cause: Failed fans, dried thermal paste, clogged heatsinks leading to thermal throttling or shutdowns.
step_1: Inspect and clean dust from fans and heatsinks; ensure fans spin freely.
step_2: Reapply thermal paste on CPU if it is older than 2–3 years.
step_3: Ensure proper case airflow: intake at front, exhaust at rear/top.
step_4: Replace failed fans and check fan headers and cables for power.
step_5: Consider upgrading cooler if temperatures remain high under load.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Clogged heatsinks - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: Bent CPU pins - my PC behaves oddly and I need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: Bent CPU pins. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: CPU / Processor Errors.
cause: CPU thermal issues, insufficient cooling, or motherboard/VRM instability.
step_1: Check CPU cooler mounting and ensure fan(s) spin at boot.
step_2: Reset BIOS to defaults and disable overclocking/XMP profiles.
step_3: Monitor CPU temperatures in BIOS or with a tool; replace thermal paste if needed.
step_4: Run a short CPU stress test to check for throttling or errors.
step_5: If CPU faults persist, consult hardware support—consider replacing CPU/motherboard.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Bent CPU pins - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: USB device shorting motherboard - my PC behaves oddly and I need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: USB device shorting motherboard. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Peripheral & External Hardware Failures.
cause: External device fault or short causing system instability or boot problems.
step_1: Disconnect external devices one-by-one and check if issue stops to identify the faulty peripheral.
step_2: Try the device on another system to confirm if it is defective.
step_3: Update peripheral drivers and firmware from the manufacturer's site.
step_4: Use a powered USB hub for devices that need extra power.
step_5: Replace the peripheral if it causes repeated system instability.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: USB device shorting motherboard - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

category: Hard Drive / SSD / Storage Device Errors
user_error_text: Disk not detected happens randomly and causes crashes.
symptoms: Symptoms: Disk not detected. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Hard Drive / SSD / Storage Device Errors.
cause: Failing storage device, bad sectors, or controller issues causing read/write errors.
step_1: Backup important data immediately to an external drive if accessible.
step_2: Run SMART check using vendor tools (CrystalDiskInfo) to inspect drive health.
step_3: Run chkdsk on the affected drive: `chkdsk D: /f /r` (replace D: as needed).
step_4: Try connecting the drive to another port or PC to verify detection.
step_5: If SMART indicates failure, replace the drive and restore data from backup.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Disk not detected - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: Beep codes indicating board fault happens randomly and causes crashes.
symptoms: Symptoms: Beep codes indicating board fault. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Motherboard Errors.
cause: Faulty motherboard components, damaged traces, or failed POST due to VRM or chipset faults.
step_1: Power down, unplug, and inspect motherboard for visible damage or bulging caps.
step_2: Clear CMOS by removing CMOS battery or using jumper to reset BIOS settings.
step_3: Reseat CPU, RAM, and power connectors; ensure no standoffs short the board.
step_4: Listen for beep codes and consult manual to interpret POST errors.
step_5: If board is faulty, backup data and replace the motherboard.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Beep codes indicating board fault - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

cause: Unstable or insufficient power delivery from the power supply affecting system stability.
step_1: Check all power cables (24-pin, 8-pin) are fully connected to motherboard and GPU.
step_2: Try a different known-good power outlet and avoid overloaded power strips.
step_3: If possible, test with a spare PSU or a PSU tester to verify voltages.
step_4: Do not continue using a PSU that emits burning smells—replace immediately.
step_5: Ensure PSU wattage is sufficient for your components; upgrade if underpowered.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.

cause: Unstable or insufficient power delivery from the power supply affecting system stability.
step_1: Check all power cables (24-pin, 8-pin) are fully connected to motherboard and GPU.
step_2: Try a different known-good power outlet and avoid overloaded power strips.
step_3: If possible, test with a spare PSU or a PSU tester to verify voltages.
step_4: Do not continue using a PSU that emits burning smells—replace immediately.
step_5: Ensure PSU wattage is sufficient for your components; upgrade if underpowered.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: PSU overload under GPU load - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: My computer reports: UNEXPECTED_KERNEL_MODE_TRAP — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: UNEXPECTED_KERNEL_MODE_TRAP. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: CPU / Processor Errors.
cause: CPU thermal issues, insufficient cooling, or motherboard/VRM instability.
step_1: Check CPU cooler mounting and ensure fan(s) spin at boot.
step_2: Reset BIOS to defaults and disable overclocking/XMP profiles.
step_3: Monitor CPU temperatures in BIOS or with a tool; replace thermal paste if needed.
step_4: Run a short CPU stress test to check for throttling or errors.
step_5: If CPU faults persist, consult hardware support—consider replacing CPU/motherboard.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: UNEXPECTED_KERNEL_MODE_TRAP - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: After recent changes I now experience: Thermal throttling.
symptoms: Symptoms: Thermal throttling. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: CPU / Processor Errors.
cause: CPU thermal issues, insufficient cooling, or motherboard/VRM instability.
step_1: Check CPU cooler mounting and ensure fan(s) spin at boot.
step_2: Reset BIOS to defaults and disable overclocking/XMP profiles.
step_3: Monitor CPU temperatures in BIOS or with a tool; replace thermal paste if needed.
step_4: Run a short CPU stress test to check for throttling or errors.
step_5: If CPU faults persist, consult hardware support—consider replacing CPU/motherboard.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Thermal throttling - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: GPU fan not spinning happens randomly and causes crashes.
symptoms: Symptoms: GPU fan not spinning. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Cooling System Errors.
cause: Failed fans, dried thermal paste, clogged heatsinks leading to thermal throttling or shutdowns.
step_1: Inspect and clean dust from fans and heatsinks; ensure fans spin freely.
step_2: Reapply thermal paste on CPU if it is older than 2–3 years.
step_3: Ensure proper case airflow: intake at front, exhaust at rear/top.
step_4: Replace failed fans and check fan headers and cables for power.
step_5: Consider upgrading cooler if temperatures remain high under load.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: GPU fan not spinning - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: I see 'Faulty HDMI cable' and the system is unstable.
symptoms: Symptoms: Faulty HDMI cable. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Cable & Connector Issues.
cause: Loose or damaged cables/connectors causing intermittent device detection or power issues.
step_1: Power down and reseat SATA/HDMI/DisplayPort/PCIe power cables securely.
step_2: Try a different cable to rule out a faulty cable.
step_3: Inspect connectors for bent pins or corrosion and replace if damaged.
step_4: Ensure cables are not pinched and have proper strain relief.
step_5: Use cable ties to avoid accidental unplugging and test again.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Faulty HDMI cable - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

cause: Loose or damaged cables/connectors causing intermittent device detection or power issues.

user_error_text: MEMORY_MANAGEMENT crash happens randomly and causes crashes.
symptoms: Symptoms: MEMORY_MANAGEMENT crash. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: RAM / Memory Errors.
cause: Faulty RAM modules, incorrect timings/voltage, or slot issues causing memory errors.
step_1: Power off and unplug the PC, then carefully remove and reseat RAM sticks.
step_2: Try one RAM stick at a time to identify a faulty module.
step_3: Run Windows Memory Diagnostic (mdsched.exe) or MemTest86 for extended testing.
step_4: Check BIOS for correct memory settings; disable XMP/overclocking to test stability.
step_5: Replace the failing RAM module if diagnostics report errors.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: MEMORY_MANAGEMENT crash - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: I see 'Case airflow insufficient' and the system is unstable.
symptoms: Symptoms: Case airflow insufficient. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Overheating & Thermal Failures.
cause: Poor airflow, failed cooling components, or degraded thermal interface causing overheating.
step_1: Check case fans and airflow; clean dust and ensure unobstructed vents.
step_2: Monitor temperatures under load and at idle to identify spikes.
step_3: Reapply thermal paste to CPU/GPU if paste is old or dried.
step_4: Ensure laptop vents are clear and use a cooling pad for laptops.
step_5: If temperatures remain high, upgrade cooling components (better cooler, additional fans).
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Case airflow insufficient - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: My computer reports: Beep codes indicating board fault — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Beep codes indicating board fault. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Motherboard Errors.
cause: Faulty motherboard components, damaged traces, or failed POST due to VRM or chipset faults.
step_1: Power down, unplug, and inspect motherboard for visible damage or bulging caps.
step_2: Clear CMOS by removing CMOS battery or using jumper to reset BIOS settings.
step_3: Reseat CPU, RAM, and power connectors; ensure no standoffs short the board.
step_4: Listen for beep codes and consult manual to interpret POST errors.
step_5: If board is faulty, backup data and replace the motherboard.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Beep codes indicating board fault - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

category: Hard Drive / SSD / Storage Device Errors
user_error_text: After recent changes I now experience: Bad sectors detected.
symptoms: Symptoms: Bad sectors detected. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Hard Drive / SSD / Storage Device Errors.
cause: Failing storage device, bad sectors, or controller issues causing read/write errors.
step_1: Backup important data immediately to an external drive if accessible.
step_2: Run SMART check using vendor tools (CrystalDiskInfo) to inspect drive health.
step_3: Run chkdsk on the affected drive: `chkdsk D: /f /r` (replace D: as needed).
step_4: Try connecting the drive to another port or PC to verify detection.
step_5: If SMART indicates failure, replace the drive and restore data from backup.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Bad sectors detected - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: My computer reports: Black screen when GPU activates — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Black screen when GPU activates. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: GPU / Graphics Card Errors.
cause: GPU overheating, driver failure, or power/connectivity issues to the graphics card.
step_1: Ensure GPU power connectors are firmly attached and card is seated in PCIe slot.
step_2: Boot into Safe Mode and reinstall GPU drivers (use DDU for clean uninstall).
step_3: Monitor GPU temperatures and clean dust from heatsink/fans.
step_4: Test with integrated graphics or another GPU to isolate the card.
step_5: If hardware failure confirmed, RMA or replace the GPU.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Black screen when GPU activates - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: After recent changes I now experience: Screen artifacts.
symptoms: Symptoms: Screen artifacts. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: GPU / Graphics Card Errors.
cause: GPU overheating, driver failure, or power/connectivity issues to the graphics card.
step_1: Ensure GPU power connectors are firmly attached and card is seated in PCIe slot.
step_2: Boot into Safe Mode and reinstall GPU drivers (use DDU for clean uninstall).
step_3: Monitor GPU temperatures and clean dust from heatsink/fans.
step_4: Test with integrated graphics or another GPU to isolate the card.
step_5: If hardware failure confirmed, RMA or replace the GPU.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Screen artifacts - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

cause: GPU overheating, driver failure, or power/connectivity issues to the graphics card.

user_error_text: GPU fan not spinning happens randomly and causes crashes.
symptoms: Symptoms: GPU fan not spinning. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Cooling System Errors.
cause: Failed fans, dried thermal paste, clogged heatsinks leading to thermal throttling or shutdowns.
step_1: Inspect and clean dust from fans and heatsinks; ensure fans spin freely.
step_2: Reapply thermal paste on CPU if it is older than 2–3 years.
step_3: Ensure proper case airflow: intake at front, exhaust at rear/top.
step_4: Replace failed fans and check fan headers and cables for power.
step_5: Consider upgrading cooler if temperatures remain high under load.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: GPU fan not spinning - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

category: Hard Drive / SSD / Storage Device Errors
user_error_text: Clicking HDD noise happens randomly and causes crashes.
symptoms: Symptoms: Clicking HDD noise. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Hard Drive / SSD / Storage Device Errors.
cause: Failing storage device, bad sectors, or controller issues causing read/write errors.
step_1: Backup important data immediately to an external drive if accessible.
step_2: Run SMART check using vendor tools (CrystalDiskInfo) to inspect drive health.
step_3: Run chkdsk on the affected drive: `chkdsk D: /f /r` (replace D: as needed).
step_4: Try connecting the drive to another port or PC to verify detection.
step_5: If SMART indicates failure, replace the drive and restore data from backup.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Clicking HDD noise - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: After recent changes I now experience: Memory instability (XMP/OC).
symptoms: Symptoms: Memory instability (XMP/OC). Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: RAM / Memory Errors.
cause: Faulty RAM modules, incorrect timings/voltage, or slot issues causing memory errors.
step_1: Power off and unplug the PC, then carefully remove and reseat RAM sticks.
step_2: Try one RAM stick at a time to identify a faulty module.
step_3: Run Windows Memory Diagnostic (mdsched.exe) or MemTest86 for extended testing.
step_4: Check BIOS for correct memory settings; disable XMP/overclocking to test stability.
step_5: Replace the failing RAM module if diagnostics report errors.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Memory instability (XMP/OC) - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: My computer reports: Burning smell from PSU — how to fix?
symptoms: Symptoms: Burning smell from PSU. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Power Supply Unit (PSU) Errors.
cause: Unstable or insufficient power delivery from the power supply affecting system stability.
step_1: Check all power cables (24-pin, 8-pin) are fully connected to motherboard and GPU.
step_2: Try a different known-good power outlet and avoid overloaded power strips.
step_3: If possible, test with a spare PSU or a PSU tester to verify voltages.
step_4: Do not continue using a PSU that emits burning smells—replace immediately.
step_5: Ensure PSU wattage is sufficient for your components; upgrade if underpowered.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Burning smell from PSU - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: Faulty keyboard causing freezes - my PC behaves oddly and I need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: Faulty keyboard causing freezes. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Peripheral & External Hardware Failures.
cause: External device fault or short causing system instability or boot problems.
step_1: Disconnect external devices one-by-one and check if issue stops to identify the faulty peripheral.
step_2: Try the device on another system to confirm if it is defective.
step_3: Update peripheral drivers and firmware from the manufacturer's site.
step_4: Use a powered USB hub for devices that need extra power.
step_5: Replace the peripheral if it causes repeated system instability.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Faulty keyboard causing freezes - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: After recent changes I now experience: CPU overheating -> shutdown.
symptoms: Symptoms: CPU overheating -> shutdown. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Overheating & Thermal Failures.
cause: Poor airflow, failed cooling components, or degraded thermal interface causing overheating.
step_1: Check case fans and airflow; clean dust and ensure unobstructed vents.
step_2: Monitor temperatures under load and at idle to identify spikes.
step_3: Reapply thermal paste to CPU/GPU if paste is old or dried.
step_4: Ensure laptop vents are clear and use a cooling pad for laptops.
step_5: If temperatures remain high, upgrade cooling components (better cooler, additional fans).
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: CPU overheating -> shutdown - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

cause: Poor airflow, failed cooling components, or degraded thermal interface causing overheating.
step_1: Check case fans and airflow; clean dust and ensure unobstructed vents.

user_error_text: After recent changes I now experience: Failed motherboard POST.
symptoms: Symptoms: Failed motherboard POST. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Motherboard Errors.
cause: Faulty motherboard components, damaged traces, or failed POST due to VRM or chipset faults.
step_1: Power down, unplug, and inspect motherboard for visible damage or bulging caps.
step_2: Clear CMOS by removing CMOS battery or using jumper to reset BIOS settings.
step_3: Reseat CPU, RAM, and power connectors; ensure no standoffs short the board.
step_4: Listen for beep codes and consult manual to interpret POST errors.
step_5: If board is faulty, backup data and replace the motherboard.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Failed motherboard POST - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: I see 'Machine Check Exception (MCE)' and the system is unstable.
symptoms: Symptoms: Machine Check Exception (MCE). Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: CPU / Processor Errors.
cause: CPU thermal issues, insufficient cooling, or motherboard/VRM instability.
step_1: Check CPU cooler mounting and ensure fan(s) spin at boot.
step_2: Reset BIOS to defaults and disable overclocking/XMP profiles.
step_3: Monitor CPU temperatures in BIOS or with a tool; replace thermal paste if needed.
step_4: Run a short CPU stress test to check for throttling or errors.
step_5: If CPU faults persist, consult hardware support—consider replacing CPU/motherboard.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.

step_1: Check case fans and airflow; clean dust and ensure unobstructed vents.
step_2: Monitor temperatures under load and at idle to identify spikes.
step_3: Reapply thermal paste to CPU/GPU if paste is old or dried.
step_4: Ensure laptop vents are clear and use a cooling pad for laptops.
step_5: If temperatures remain high, upgrade cooling components (better cooler, additional fans).
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: HDD overheating in laptop - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: RAM slot failure - my PC behaves oddly and I need help.
symptoms: Symptoms: RAM slot failure. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Motherboard Errors.
cause: Faulty motherboard components, damaged traces, or failed POST due to VRM or chipset faults.
step_1: Power down, unplug, and inspect motherboard for visible damage or bulging caps.
step_2: Clear CMOS by removing CMOS battery or using jumper to reset BIOS settings.
step_3: Reseat CPU, RAM, and power connectors; ensure no standoffs short the board.
step_4: Listen for beep codes and consult manual to interpret POST errors.
step_5: If board is faulty, backup data and replace the motherboard.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: RAM slot failure - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

cause: Faulty motherboard components, damaged traces, or failed POST due to VRM or chipset faults.
step_1: Power down, unplug, and inspect motherboard for visible damage or bulging caps.

category: Hard Drive / SSD / Storage Device Errors
user_error_text: I see 'Clicking HDD noise' and the system is unstable.
symptoms: Symptoms: Clicking HDD noise. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: Hard Drive / SSD / Storage Device Errors.
cause: Failing storage device, bad sectors, or controller issues causing read/write errors.
step_1: Backup important data immediately to an external drive if accessible.
step_2: Run SMART check using vendor tools (CrystalDiskInfo) to inspect drive health.
step_3: Run chkdsk on the affected drive: `chkdsk D: /f /r` (replace D: as needed).
step_4: Try connecting the drive to another port or PC to verify detection.
step_5: If SMART indicates failure, replace the drive and restore data from backup.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Clicking HDD noise - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.

user_error_text: After recent changes I now experience: Screen artifacts.
symptoms: Symptoms: Screen artifacts. Typically causes instability, crashes, failure to boot, or degraded performance. Category: GPU / Graphics Card Errors.
cause: GPU overheating, driver failure, or power/connectivity issues to the graphics card.
step_1: Ensure GPU power connectors are firmly attached and card is seated in PCIe slot.
step_2: Boot into Safe Mode and reinstall GPU drivers (use DDU for clean uninstall).
step_3: Monitor GPU temperatures and clean dust from heatsink/fans.
step_4: Test with integrated graphics or another GPU to isolate the card.
step_5: If hardware failure confirmed, RMA or replace the GPU.
verification: System runs stable under normal use and stress tests without reproducing the hardware fault.
log_snippet: Screen artifacts - Hardware diagnostic entry or SMART log recorded.
